hello.

> On Jun 17, 2015, at 11:02, Aristotle Pagaltzis pagaltzis@... [=
rest-discuss] <rest-discuss-noreply@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> * kalguni@yah=
oo.com [rest-discuss] <rest-discuss-noreply@yahoogroups.com> [2015-06-17 03=
:40]:
>> I read lots of articles on these. Yet it seems to be more of
>> a =
personal choice rather than an Industry standard.
> It is personal choice. =
As far as REST is concerned, you can use GUIDs
> as your URLs for all the d=
ifference it makes. Of course, in practice
> =E2=80=9CREST API=E2=80=9D is =
code for =E2=80=9CHTTP/RPC hybrid=E2=80=9D and not at all a hypermedia-
> d=
riven design, but even so, it=E2=80=99s up to you. It=E2=80=99s essentially=
 similar
> to naming functions or methods =E2=80=93 there *is* bad design a=
nd bad ideas,
> but there is no correctness criterion.

only because it's m=
isused and misinterpreted in many places doesn't mean it isn't well-defined=
, or that you cannot do it right or do it wrong. many REST labels are simpl=
y wrongly assigned for marketing reasons, but at least on this list we shou=
ld know better and not tell people that it's essentially meaningless. it's =
not, and getting it right or not makes a difference in practice.

cheers,

=
dret.
